body.p: In accordance with the Constitution adopted by the Fellowship in August 2012 as a result of the Review of General Council, the RANZCP is conducting elections in early 2013 for the new Board including the position of President-Elect and five (5) Elected Directors.

The term of the President-Elect is two (2) years, followed by a two (2)-year term as President. The initial term for Elected Directors is three (3) years. In 2016, at the conclusion of this first term, Elected Directors will be eligible for re-election to complete two (2) further terms of two (2) years each.

The current President-Elect, Dr Murray Patton, will assume the office of President on 29th May 2013. The new Board will take office at Congress on Wednesday 29th May 2013 at the conclusion of the Annual General Meeting.

As Australasian Psychiatry went to press, nominations for the Board had closed and voting is underway. Votes are cast electronically, although postal votes will be made available for Fellows who do not have an email address registered with the College. All Fellows are encouraged to vote before voting closes on April 10th.

Full information regarding nominations and the election process was provided to all Fellows in January. For more information about the Board elections contact Louise Hain, Manager Governance and the Office of the President and CEO on +61 3 9601 4955 or louise.hain@ranzcp.org.
